column4: Hello.... can anyone help me with installing ubuntu so that my wife can still use Windows XP?
Well, I'm not sure where to instal Ubuntu at... my F drive, or the partition(M:) on my main HD(C:)

The key phrase is "dual-boot", I suggest you backup your system, with the assumption that the installation will kill it (Very unlikely, but I'm a pedantic person), install Ubuntu, resize your windows partitions to give room, and see how that works.

If windows got messed up, try deleting everything, install windows in a much smaller partition, reserving about 6 GB or however much you think you'll need for Ubuntu, then install Ubuntu in the free space.
